Utterance: hi, ellie
Hi! It’s nice to see you again. How have you been since our last session?
I’ve been doing better! I started volunteering at a local community center.
That’s fantastic news! How has the experience been for you?
It’s been really rewarding. I’m working with kids, and it feels great to give back.
That’s wonderful! It sounds like you’re tapping into your strengths. How do the kids respond to you?
They seem to enjoy my company. I think they appreciate having someone to talk to.
That’s a valuable connection. Have you learned anything new about yourself through this experience?
I’ve realized how much I enjoy being around kids. It makes me think more seriously about counseling.
That’s a significant insight! How does that make you feel about your future career path?
It excites me! I feel like I’m on the right track.
That’s great to hear! Have you thought about what steps you might take next in pursuing counseling?
I’m looking into programs for social work or counseling at local colleges.
That’s an excellent direction! Researching programs is a proactive step. How do you feel about committing to that process?
I feel motivated. I want to make a positive impact on others, just like I’m doing now.
That’s a beautiful intention. Have you considered what specific areas of counseling interest you the most?
I’m drawn to working with children and families, especially those facing challenges similar to mine.
That’s a meaningful focus. Your personal experiences can bring a unique perspective to your work. How do you think that will influence your approach?
I think it will help me connect with clients on a deeper level. I want them to feel understood.
That’s a powerful goal. Building rapport is essential in counseling. How are your boys doing? Have they adjusted to the changes in your life?
They seem to be doing well. I think they appreciate seeing me more engaged and happy.
That’s wonderful! Children often pick up on their parents’ emotions. Have you had any new conversations with them about their feelings?
Yes, I made it a point to ask them about their day more often, and they’ve opened up about their worries.
That’s a great practice! Encouraging open dialogue can foster a supportive environment. How do you feel when they share their worries with you?
It makes me feel connected to them, but it also worries me knowing they’re stressed.
It’s natural to feel that way. Have you discussed coping strategies with them?
We talked about taking breaks and doing things we enjoy together.
That’s a great approach! Family activities can strengthen your bond. What’s one activity you’re looking forward to doing together?
I’d love to take them to the beach for a day of fun.
That sounds like a perfect plan! How do you think that will benefit all of you?
I think it’ll help us unwind and create some happy memories together.
Absolutely! Creating positive experiences is important for both you and your children. Before we wrap up, what’s one goal you’d like to focus on before our next session?
I want to finalize my college research and maybe apply to a program.
That sounds like a solid goal! I’m excited to hear about your progress next time.
Thanks, Ellie! I appreciate your support.
You’re doing amazing work. I look forward to our next session!
Bye for now!
Bye! Take care!
